department.dept_long_name: Committee on Degrees in History and Literature

course.title: Postcolonial Ireland
course.description: Southern Ireland charted a unique course through the twentieth century. It began the century as a quasi-colonial part of the United Kingdom, and ended it the "Celtic Tiger," the success story of the European Union. This course explores that history through literature, historical documents, and scholarship. In particular, it asks: how can we make use of the insights of postcolonial theory to understand the Irish twentieth century? We'll consider the core themes of language, violence, sexuality, and economics.
